lexUnit.name: mutter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say in a barely audible voice.

sentence.text: ` Thanks , " he muttered , still wary of his rescuer 's reaction .
` Perhaps you are right , " he muttered .
` Some father , " Whitlock muttered .
Kevin cast his eyes up to heaven and muttered , ` Give me strength ! "
` Just go away , " she muttered .
He resigned himself to the inevitable , and grudgingly muttered , ` Proceed with the prosecution . "
` Raw shellfish for breakfast , " muttered Ann .
" I 'm ruined , " muttered the young dealer .
` There are n't horses that would carry them , " muttered Caspar .
` No matter , " muttered Auguste .
` Fine thanks , " muttered Mr Trotter under his breath .
Some of the old Polish poison is back , too ; people mutter that former prime minister Mazowiecki lost the presidential election because he had too many Jewish advisers .
Christopher swiftly arranged for a six foot wall to be built along his boundary , and angrily muttered that it was going to have to be the Scottish islands .
Candy refused and the Italian had wandered off muttering that he would do it alone .
Once round the loch and they headed back for their car , muttering that we were wasting our time because there was not a single fish in the loch .
She seemed embarrassed and muttered that her mother had given Terry the photograph , but before she said any more Mrs Redmond began to ask Joe about the war news .
Behind him he could hear one of the boys mutter that Mr Wilson had gone mad , and another reply that he always had been .
The Doctor muttered that he knew best and that life was rarely logical .
She accepted the glass and muttered a word of thanks .
` Well ! " muttered Peggy indignantly .
He muttered the words unhappily .
" 'T IS a wench , " muttered the first man uneasily .
I shivered and muttered a curse .
Karr muttered something , then pressed a second tiny bundle into the man 's hand .
He muttered a greeting .
He looked at the stubborn set of her mouth and muttered something -- obviously rude -- in Italian .
But for the sake of peace and quiet , she muttered an apology and scrambled to her feet .
Rutherford was muttering something about a by-pass always changing a country community , as if he felt the need to apologise for the place .
Lord Wakeham , who had come with the necessary cheque , had muttered something about boys being boys , and that Robertson would do well to go to his hotel and sleep it off .
Robert got up and , muttering something about marking , made as if to leave .
Sir John had then stamped off , muttering curses about public officials who did n't seem to care .
He muttered something about the place being primitive .
They began to criticize and mutter doubts about the stability of the fairy-tale marriage .
He turned away , muttering something about Vincent 's vicious character .
` Thank God , " muttered Dyson to Bob intensely .
Queen Margaret muttered something to Catesby .
Hannah Dooley , her nostrils flared , was muttering something to herself .
Eventually I untangled them and muttered something to him about it having been a hair-raising experience
Benjamin muttered something to himself .
The man eyed Doyle contemptuously then muttered something to himself and moved to another table and sat down .
` Blimmin' blue , " muttered Tom to himself as he observed Willie 's face .
Bowring stared at the face that was appearing , then he muttered a denial to himself as he struggled to lower the binoculars , to let go his shivering grip on them , look away .
Lucenzo muttered something to the man , who grinned understandingly .
` Too mean to offer a living wage , " muttered Tom Tedder to the young man beside him .
Clare muttered vague replies to these remarks .
` You were walking along muttering them to yourself .
Leif turned away , retching , whilst Cranston stalked out of his house muttering vengeance against all and sundry .
We inched towards our car , muttering instructions at each other like a pair of furniture removers used to working together .
His lean face darkened and he muttered something in Portuguese beneath his breath .
She watched as the woman muttered something in Italian and Guido responded with a couple of sharp questions .
Alexei muttered the formula under his breath .
Karen also rose , muttering something about checking to see how the meringue was coming along .
Hope bowed more elegantly , muttered the line about being her servant but concentrated all his will on the first look direct .
Miles went very red , muttered something about ` things to get on with " and left the room .
He looked strangely at me , muttered something about coming back within the hour , and sauntered off .
Although he was pleased that they had managed to set everything up on time , he continued to mutter about the remaining android being alive , threatening them from somewhere on the planet .
Somebody was muttering about a bomb scare at Marks , which accounted for the influx .

Dameta had taken one look at her heated countenance when she 'd emerged from the pleasance , and had ordered her to bed , muttering about fevers and the carelessness of wandering about in gardens without a mantle .
The housekeeper left the room , muttering about ingratitude .
As they headed off on their Whitsun holiday , backbenchers were already muttering about the next shake-up .
Gran had been muttering about storms for days and she liked her to stay close at these times .
Charles found himself muttering to the motherly dresser , who handed him his hat .
` Oh , come on , " she muttered to herself .
The clicking stopped and Meg muttered to herself .
He gulped down what he was given but continued muttering urgently to himself .
` Eeny , meeny , " he muttered to himself .
` He is coming , " he muttered to himself , almost tentatively .
` You know , I 'm getting quite used to this invisible business , " Mitch muttered to Maggie when they were at last settled to their table .
That 's what 's had you muttering under your breath for the last hour ? "
` I need a drink , " he muttered beneath his breath .
He was ill-washed and stubble-chinned and he muttered beneath his breath .
` I 'll deal with you later , " Otley muttered at me .
Gwyneth Dunwoody stated that we were secretly dismantling the health service and Roy Hattersley muttered about contracting out old people like refuse collection .
Some made their excuses and left , muttering about being able to hire a video any time they wanted .
They are muttering about having City Hall 's powers decentralised in their favour .
The guitars scratch at your eyes , Medicine lynchpin Brad Laner mutters away in the background , and all of a sudden , it 's nine minutes , eight seconds later .
The old woman shouldered her bag again , giving him a baleful look , and went muttering away .
Stop muttering away to yourself . "
then you see or somebody you know looking at the long jump and they 're muttering away to themselves .
Maisie , from deep inside her black linen bag , was muttering about how it was all right for some people .
Father Poole muttered abstractedly , turning over the pages .
A knot of dark-suited Garrick members had gathered in the hall and were muttering anxiously .
Hencke muttered bitterly , glancing derisively at the few pounds in his hand .
She pushed computer buttons , picked up a telephone , muttered discreetly and then turned back to Jack saying , ` He 's in Abbey Ward .
What a fool you are , Robyn Drew ! she muttered fiercely .
" Nonsense , " the doctor had muttered gruffly when she had attempted to explain her fears to him .
The old woman once again muttered incoherently as though complaining and then pulling herself together said clearly : ` Does your father wish it ? "
` There 's no call for an angel , " the devil-man would mutter malevolently .

More than 100 sullen villagers were muttering outside yesterday , afraid to approach the polling station where the assistant district magistrate and scores of police are trying to create the impression that polling is normal .
` Goodbye , my friend , " the Doctor muttered softly and raised his hat in farewell .
